comments: This course explores constitutional criminal procedure or the law of the Fourth, Fifth, and Sixth Amendments to the United States Constitution. Topics included the laws and rules associated with search and seizure, arrest, interrogation, the exclusionary rule, and deprivation of counsel. Social science evidence that supports or raises questions about legal doctrine will be examined.   Students really enjoyed the class and the material. One student said, "Best course I have taken at Penn," while a former senior said, "One of the best classes I took my entire 4 years in Penn."  Students commend Professor Laufer for being an, "excellent" professor. One student claimed that, "he was one of the few professors I have encountered at Penn that has successfully found a way to be a master of his subject while still be relatable and inspirational."   No prerequisites are required to take this class. Students recommended this class to both majors and non-majors. It is open to both freshmen and upperclassmen.
